meanings.sent1: The sudden clats of thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clats of fireworks in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The clats of the pots and pans falling made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The clats of the crashing waves against the shore were like nature's music.
meanings.sent5: The clats of the car horns in the city were deafening.

meanings.sent1: She picked up the tiny clats of broken glass carefully.
meanings.sent2: The artist used colorful clats of paper to create a collage.
meanings.sent3: The clats of the puzzle were scattered all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The clats of memories in her mind formed a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The clats of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.

meanings.definition: To make a loud noise or sound.
meanings.sent1: The drummers began to clats rhythmically at the festival.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks will clats loudly during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: He likes to clats on his guitar when he's feeling happy.
meanings.sent4: The engines of the race cars clats as they sped around the track.
meanings.sent5: The children clats with joy as they played in the park.
